author: Pamela Muse
text:
Los Angeles County is interested in learning about new ways to identify and repair maintenance deficiences as well as reduce noise of heavy beach equipment.  Specifically:

How to effectively identify and repair maintenance deficiencies in areas (with Department maintained infrastructure) such as parking lots, walking paths, public restrooms, lifeguard facilities, and park community buildings.  Our Department already has a good program for looking out for deficiencies in these areas that we take care of, but there is always room to improve and we are wondering if there are other ways of looking for deficiencies (perhaps using technological devices?) that would help a department adjusting to budget cuts and the strain that puts on personnel hours.  Maybe there are other creative methods as well that allow staff to inspect a large area (such as a large parking lot) and identify hazards or deteriorating conditions. 
How to reduce noise from our beach heavy equipment while still remaining in compliance with CAL OSHA laws.  Our machinery cleans the beach early in the morning, and we do receive complaints from nearby residents about the noise, so we would need research done on noise reducing devices for our equipment. 

Thank you.  I look forward to your solutions! 
Walter Popoff, Executive Assistant
Los Angeles County, CA
title: Maintenance Deficiences & Reduce Heavy Beach Equip Noise
